Doing so can release hazardous gases. Keep away from children's reach.","Directions For Use":"Clothes washing:\nTypes of fabrics you can bleach: cotton, linen, synthetics, permanent press and most colored fabrics that can be safely bleached. Do not use odex on silk, wool, mohair, leather, or non - fast colors. \nColor bleaching test: a quick, easy bleach test for colors, mix one tablespoon odex with 1\/4 cup water. Apply one drop of this solution to a hidden portion of fabric. Let stand for one minute, if there is no change in color, fabric can be safely bleached.\nAutomatic machine washing: one cup of odex per washing machine load with good laundry detergent should provide excellent cleaning results. For heavily soiled or large loads you may add more odex.\nHand washing: add 1\/8 cup odex per gallon of sudsy water for normal hand washing. Use little more odex for heavily soiled cloth. Use rubber gloves to protect your hands. \nGeneral cleaning and disinfecting:\nUse odex to clean and deodorize bathrooms and kitchens. It cleans by removing stains and killing germs that cause odors.\nToilets bowls: pour in 1\/2 cup of odex, brush entire bowl.
